results.title: Content Technical Writer with Development Experience
results.description:
Graphite is a boutique digital marketing firm that builds scalable growth engines for consumer technology companies such as Ticketmaster, MasterClass, BetterUp, and Honey. We specialize in search engine optimization (SEO), content strategy, mobile app growth, and conversion optimization. We are a fully distributed team that is dedicated to creating an environment where you do the best work of your career. With headquarters in San Francisco and team members across North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia, we are ready to welcome our next team member!

 

  • This is a fully remote work opportunity

  • Contract work

  • This position requires delivering from 10 - 20 articles per month

 

Responsibilities:

  • Create impactful, objective-oriented content for our clients and brands.

  • Research, brainstorm, and pitch creative and compelling article topics

  • Fact-check, proofread, and edit content for accuracy and comprehensiveness

  • Work with our internal teams to identify opportunities and plan improvements to existing content and internal processes

  • 1-2+ years experience in development or engineering, or writing about these topics

  • Experience with APIs and databases

  • Cybersecurity

  • Email systems

  • Excellent writing and communication skills.

  • Able to absorb new material quickly.

  • Proven ability to manage projects and juggle a diverse workload.

  • Ability to meet any and all deadlines.

  • Skilled with Google Workspace applications (primarily Docs, Slides, and Sheets).

 

Plus skills:

  • Experience working in a startup or agency environment.

  • Past experience working in a content management system is helpful.

  • Photo editing experience (Photoshop, Gimp, etc.).

  • SEO experience with topic selection, keywords, title tags, meta descriptions.

 

How we’ll help:

Graphite’s mission is to create an environment where you build the best work of your career. In order to facilitate this, we provide:

  • Process As Needed - We view the process as a way to empower better work, not as a series of dogmatic rules. We develop the best internal processes as we do products - through iteration, measurement, and continuous improvement.

  • Autonomy - We trust you to be excellent at what you do. We will provide as much support as needed when needed, but no more. You will have autonomy and agency to drive projects forward, and own decisions and outcomes.

  • Flexible Work Environment - Everyone’s optimal work style is unique. We operate as a distributed team across North & Latin America and Asia. We optimize for productivity and performance, not time spent in an office. Help us build an optimal work environment that fits you as an individual.

  • Compensation - We want to work with the best people in the World and compensate accordingly.

 

Graphite provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information or any other protected classification.

results.title: Senior Software Tester
results.description:
INKUBIT specialises in the introduction and further development of solutions in the areas of Microsoft Dynamics 365 (CE/Sales) and BI & Analytics (Power BI). As a full-service provider, INKUBIT covers the complete application life cycle from consulting and introduction to implementation and maintenance of the systems. We support companies in developing their full potential and continuously increasing their company value. With our interdisciplinary knowledge, we support our customers in becoming a high-performance company in the age of digital transformation. As an IT and consulting company founded by digital natives, we know the challenges of our generation.

Your main tasks
  • Implementation, execution and evaluation of manual and automated tests
  • Creation of specifications and test cases
  • Support of software developers and SW quality management
  • Execute: regression, E2E, ad hoc, probing, REST API, functional and non-functional tests
  • Analyze the results and communicate observations to the development team
  • Regularly informing the project manager about the progress of the testing activities
  • Identification of improvement potentials in UI, UX and business processes
  • Assistance in administrative tasks such as the creation of new accounts and the allocation of licenses to users

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Working with the latest cloud technologies in national and international projects
  • The chance to have a direct influence on the company
  • A competitive salary package with additional performance incentives
  • Location-independent digital working with flexible working hours
  • Promotion of studies and training and further education
  • Capital-forming benefits and a company pension scheme
  • Regular team events

WHAT WE EXPECT

  • Degree in economics or computer science or a comparable course of study
  • The willingness to become familiar with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM
  • Min. 3 years of experience in the field of software testing
  • Basic knowledge of C#, DevOps
  • Experience in Selenium, Cucumber or similar 
  • Experience with agile methods
  • Motivation and personal responsibility
  • Team and communication skills and pleasure in working with customers
  • High ability to work in a team, flexibility and resilience as well as fluent English

PREFERRED SKILLS & CERTIFICATES

  • Good German language skills are an advantage
  • Initial experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and Microsoft BI an advantage

results.title: Support Specialist
results.description:
Sunroom Rentals is a property-tech startup, headquartered in central Austin. At Sunroom, we are responsible for leasing thousands of homes and apartments. We've created a platform that enables renters to self-tour properties and apply inside our app.

We believe that renting a home should be as easy as booking a hotel. We're on a mission to reinvent leasing and to empower renters. Sunroom Rentals was started by the founders of Favor Delivery Ben & Zac. Their last company, Favor had 50,000 delivery drivers at the time it was sold to HEB Grocery. You'll be joining a super-talented, motivated, fun team, looking to change the game for renters!

We have raised over $11 million from top-tier investors including NextGen, Gigafund, Draper Associates & Founders Fund. Our investors have also backed the likes of SpaceX, Tesla, and Facebook.

Get in the know:

  • This March, Sunroom raised millions to grow across Texas, PR Here.

  • Renters love our 5-Star iPhone app -- thousands of renters use us in Austin, Texas, and we’re expanding to more cities.

 

Our Support Specialist serves a variety of critical functions for Sunroom partners and clients, primarily leasing out our listings by working with interested renters to drive them to tour and then apply to our homes. This role requires delivering stellar customer support and sales-adjacent activities. This position will work remotely from Mexico on a permanent basis.

 

What you'll be doing:

  • Inside Sales: You'll assist our Partners and Account Management team by proactively reaching out to leads, and getting our properties leased to qualified renters, as quickly as possible. You’ll help our renters arrange property tours, apply for homes, and submit applications, and you’ll be an expert at answering questions about the homes and the Sunroom process. You'll communicate with interested renters by text, email, phone, and social media platforms.

  • Phone Support: You’ll answer incoming calls from renters and outside agents, to answer questions about listings and the tour & application processes. You’ll also make outgoing calls to follow up with interested renters and agents.

  • Additional Client Support: As time allows, you may also assist with other activities to support our clients and growing team.

Why you'll love working here:

  • Innovative Company: You'll be joining a small but growing team, at an extremely innovative company that is changing the real estate market. You'll work with creative leaders with a proven track record of creating successful companies.

  • Salary: This role starts at $800/month.

  • Supportive Team: We have an amazing team to help train you and support you as you advance.

  • Modern technology: We've developed software & CRM systems to deliver the best client experience. We're building tools from the ground up to make your job easier and more efficient.

  • New School Real Estate: Awesome work environment at a company with an inspiring vision. With an expanding customer and partner base, you will be part of the new apartment and home leasing era!

  • Growth Opportunities: We are expanding our teams quickly and hire from within as we grow!

  • Diversity: Sunroom Rentals values inclusion and diversity, and is committed to building a diverse workforce.

  • Full-Time: We're looking for candidates who will be willing to work full-time, 6 days a week, with some weekend availability (schedule TBD and shifts will fall within the hours of 8am - 9pm CT each day of the week).

  • Bilingual: You are bilingual, fluent in both Spanish and English.

  • Proactive & Driven: You are driven to push for completion of the rental process, and you are not afraid to reach out by phone, text and email to potential renters. You proactively update team members on your work.

  • Adept Communicator: You are at ease communicating with renters and owners, whether via phone, email or text. You’re very comfortable making outbound calls to follow up with interested renters (leads).

  • Tech-Savvy: You are comfortable using and learning new technology. We have developed world-class proprietary software with many automated processes to help you do your work efficiently! You are used to having multiple applications and windows open while you work.

  • Highly Organized: You are highly organized, and able to track multiple moving pieces in a high-volume environment.

  • Follow-Through: You have a strong practice of follow-through and take the actions that you say you will.

  • Engaging and Empathetic: You are friendly, can easily interact with and engage potential renters. You understand the rewards as well as the challenges of the rental process from the renter’s perspective. You are also sensitive to the priorities of our owner partners, and provide them with thoroughly-vetted, high-quality rental candidates.

  • You are excited to be part of a whole new way to rent homes, and want to grow with an awesome company!

results.title: Senior Unity Developer
results.description:
FitXR is a fitness technology company working at the cutting edge of VR and MR. We’re a funded scale-up on a mission to impact more lives than any other fitness company, and build a healthier world for everyone.

We started life in 2016 in a garden shed in the UK. Today, we’re building FitXR, one of the top-downloaded apps on the Meta Quest store. We’ve raised close to $40m from top investors such as Maveron, Hiro, BoostVC and TriplePoint.

We’re a remote-first team of just under 100 people from across the US, UK, and Spain, and we’re committed to making it simpler and more enjoyable for people to get moving. We believe that anybody can fall in love with fitness and make movement part of their life.

Our team is distributed across Europe and the US. We’re guided by our Principles of Play: eight core beliefs about how we treat each other and our community. We make space for every voice, believe in the importance of a learner’s mindset, and prioritize team success over individual glory.

The FitXR app contains a growing range of fitness studios, where members can choose from box workouts with world-class trainers like Olympian Nicola Adams, powerful HIIT workouts, and immersive dance classes. While nothing compares to trying it yourself, you can watch a trailer here.

FitXR is available on Meta Quest 2 and has been downloaded by over a million people worldwide. Featured in Forbes, Empire, T3, Washington Post, Men's Health, GQ and more. In 2022, FitXR ranked 6th in The Information’s 50 Most Promising Startups.

What you’ll do 👀

  • Work closely with your cross-functional team to design, prototype and implement new features.
  • Develop subject matter expertise in one or more areas of our product so that you can identify technical risks or opportunities, and help the team tackle them.
  • Take the lead on medium-sized projects in the areas that you’re responsible for and deliver them on time and at high quality.
  • Make well-reasoned decisions and trade-offs within your area of expertise to align the team’s prioritisation with company strategy and goals, tying activity back to having business relevance or to product metrics.
  • Continuously build upon your knowledge of industry trends and apply your insight of how others solve similar problems to your domain and team.
  • Assist other team members with their planning & tasks, especially where they are operating within your own area of expertise.
  • Volunteer to coach, share skills, techniques and ways of working with your team.
  • Own quality and performance for your area and proactively partner with QA to raise the bar.

You should apply if ✅

  • Strength in C#.
  • Great verbal and written communication skills. You’ll communicate well with technical and non technical stakeholders alike.
  • Demonstrable game development experience on PC, console or mobile titles.
  • Proven track record of successful releases, or equivalent amount of industry experience.
  • Confidence using Unity OR Confidence using a commercial or in-house game engine. If you know other engine(s) we’d love to help you learn Unity.
  • Comfortable using performance analysis tools and writing optimised code.
  • Experience using source control systems.

Other Desired Skills and Experience - Having any one of these is an added plus:

  • Other programming and scripting languages, and other domains (eg web frontend, backend services, editors / tools etc).
  • Developing VR games or experiences.
  • Prior work in non-gameplay fields. Everything counts but Graphics & UI are especially interesting to us.
  • Development of systems consumed by other programmers or teams.
  • Experience writing automated tests and implementing other quality measures.
  • Familiarity with Perforce source control
  • Familiarity with developing in a Continuous Integration environment.

Our mission is to make fitness fun and accessible for everyone. To build inclusive products, we need to build an inclusive team. Please know that this list is indicative and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel you only are a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot. We promote a diverse and inclusive culture at FitXR.

Benefits

Our benefits are hosted on Ben which gives you flexibility to make choices that work for you.

🌎 Remote first: your life, your way of working

🏝 Unlimited annual leave

💰 Competitive salary with half year and end of year reviews

📈 Stock options

🌱£800 per annum learning budget

🧘 £900 per annum wellbeing budget (⛑ Private Health Insurance available within this through our benefits platform)

🏡£400 work from home budget

🤗 One In person Summit and three quarterly virtual Summits

💻 Laptop & VR headset

🚴‍♂️ Annual travel pass & cycle to work scheme

👶 12 weeks full paid family leave

results.title: Senior UX Researcher
results.description:
Have you always wanted the freedom to use the tools you hear about in blogs and research articles, but you face blockers?

Do you want to be able to conduct the research that you want to do, not what others think you should do?

Are you experienced in moderating user testing within a commercial environment?

Do you want a role where your success is measured by strong research outputs that create clear and actionable next steps for clients?

 

If this sounds interesting, then take a look at a preview of what you'll be getting stuck in with:

  • Working with around 5 clients and about 2-3 research pieces at a time
  • Ability to dictate the research you do and sell it back to clients directly
  • Large project pieces working with well-established brands, where your research will be used to direct their online strategy.
  • This is not a market research job, you'll drive targeted research to find core user problems, and A/B test solutions based on the research
  • Ability to direct your own work and innovate on research practises
  • Close relationship with clients allows you to try new things
  • Working in a pod structure - you will have a designated Designer, Analyst and Developer, who will all work from your insights.
  • You will see your research making real-time changes and get immediate feedback on whether your insights improved conversion.
  • Close relationship with a global research team, who have specialisms in many different research methods, so you can quickly upskill and try new things.

What you'll get in return:

  • Remote working (UK-based) but offices are available
  • A completely autonomous working environment
  • 27 days of paid holidays, 8 days of unpaid holiday, 3 paid charity days + bank holidays
  • Option to change your religious holidays
  • Super enhanced maternity & paternity leave
  • Health & Dental insurance and wellness/fitness subsidy
  • Free food all day in the offices which includes lunch
  • Dog-friendly offices
  • We also plant a tree for all new Brainlabbers!


All sounds great, right? So, here are our top "must haves":

  • Experience with a research background in Conversion Rate Optimisation
  • Moderated/Unmoderated user testing
  • Good storytelling and presentation of insights
  • Qualitative analysis
  • Working in a commercial business environment
  • Client/Stakeholder management - good at promoting research to clients and getting buy-in for projects.

Brainlabs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace: we are committed to equal opportunity for all applicants and employees regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation during the application process, please let us know when speaking with a member of the Recruitment Team.

results.title: Customer Success Manager
results.description:
Leadfeeder is a remote first, fast growing international SaaS scale-up. We are on a mission to bring web intelligence into business. Simply put, Leadfeeder helps companies know more about their website visitors, which enables them to convert promising visitors into sales leads.

We’re excited to share that Leadfeeder has merged with Echobot, a leading provider of European Sales Intelligence. As a result, we now have 250+ team members based across 30+ countries and six offices across the US and Europe. Together, our companies are striving to be the leading sales intelligence and go-to-market platform in our core European and North American markets.

What sets us apart? We are a market leader with a solid business model ready to be scaled. Our data-driven and customer-centric approach keeps us grounded while providing a basis for sustainable and ambitious growth.

Are you a self-starter looking to learn and grow as part of a world-class team? Join our journey!

 

About this role

We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our rapidly growing CS team (over the last 12 months, we’ve added 10 new team members)! In this role, you will work with our client base in Sweden to ensure that they have the best experience using our product.

From the beginning of your time at Leadfeeder, we will work closely with you to ensure you succeed. From a 3 week onboarding process including time with senior leaders in the business, to ongoing personal development reviews, we’ve set up an effective system to help you to thrive in your new role.

We also have an office in Stockholm, so you can choose if you'd like to work from the office or home!

If you’re passionate about technology and serving customers, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!

 

Requirements

  • Native level fluency in English and Swedish
  • Minimum of 1 year of customer success or similar experience in a SaaS business
  • You have digital sales or marketing experience.
  • You have a good understanding of marketing analytics in general.
  • You have experience working in a B2B SaaS environment.
  • You are a self-starter who defaults to trying to find a solution to a problem.
  • You are 'commercially minded' and excited to search for expansion opportunities in your client base of ~150 clients; willing to show persistence in following up on expansion opportunities.
  • A healthy curiosity about technology - be interested to learn how the product works, how we could improve it as time passes.
  • Strong time management skills - you will be working with a client base of ~150 clients, so prioritisation is a must.
  • Strong presentation skills - this is a role that involves speaking to customers every single day, and our clients expect clear, concise support.
  • Strong verbal and written communication - customers can reach out to us via phone, email, support - we need to be performing at a consistently high level across all these mediums.

Nice to haves

  • Experience working with or using one of the major CRM integrations we use (Pipedrive, Salesforce, Dynamics, Hubspot especially).
  • Fluency in another Nordic/Scandinavian language
  • Experience with reporting tools such as GDS.
  • Experience with API solutions.

You are not expected to know everything right away, but you need to be seriously motivated to learn and have the right balance of knowledge and interests to enable you to flourish and grow in this role.

Responsibilities

As a Customer Success Manager you will:

  • Onboard new clients & help with implementation.
  • Coach existing clients to improve their sales and marketing processes.
  • Minimise churn in your client base.
  • Drive upsell opportunities in your client base together with Account Managers.

What we offer

  • An international and diverse work atmosphere
  • A competitive salary
  • Regular online team building activities to have fun with your colleagues
  • Company retreats - we’ve recently returned from a week together in Croatia!
  • Personal development plans as standard, allowing you to develop the skills you think are most important to succeed in your role, as well as regular 1-2-1 and group training.

If this role excites you and sounds like a great fit, please apply below!

results.title: .NET Software Engineer
results.description:
.NET Software Engineer
New Albany, OH / Remote Opportunity

Do you like innovation and technology? We do, too. Reveleer is a healthcare software company serving health plans and care management organizations. Our teams are dedicated to disrupting and modernizing healthcare by building powerful technology that provides an amazing user experience, scalability, and automation.


Reveleer is the first of its kind in our space – a self service platform that mines health data using AI, NLP, and advanced analytics. Our Platform enables health plans to focus on the quality of care people receive, leaving the most complex and repetitive tasks for technology to solve. Be part of what Reveleer is building next!

As a Full Stack Software Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to develop both front end and backend software components. We're a hardworking, energetic team that is passionate about our customers and believes that to be successful we should never stop learning: learning about our customers, our product, and how to build better software.

What You'll Do:

  • Partner with product, engineering, and operations team to deliver against product roadmap
  • Deliver procedures and frameworks to avoid technical debt
  • Bring forward creative technical solutions to handle complex business requirements
  • Remove roadblocks for team members, both technical and otherwise
  • Clearly communicating to multiple stakeholders: engineers, product managers, operations, and leadership team
  • Providing technical guidance to engineering and QA teams
  • Partner with researchers and technology experts in understanding technology development current state and future goals to inform software requirements definition, design, implementation, test, and verification and validation efforts
  • You should have a strong grasp of front-end design and technologies that can help solve complex problems without sacrifices to performance. You should have an eye for clean code and be an advocate for coding best practices and code quality standards. 

About You:

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices such as code reviews, testing, version control and build processes
  • Excellent cross-team communication
  • Experience with a modern front-end framework (Angular, React etc.)
  • Experience writing REST / JSON APIs using C#
  • Ability to solve technical problems independently
  • Motivation to work hard and always be learning
  • Previous experience working with our tech stack (C#, Python and React)
  • Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, NOSQL and ORM technologies (Dapper)
  • Professional experience with modern web frameworks such as Angular 2+ and ReactJS
  • Proficiency in JavaScript (ES6) and TypeScript
  • Understanding of HTML and CSS
  • Experience using CSS preprocessors
  • Able to create highly reusable components
  • Experience with component UI libraries
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure preferably within AWS

Preferred:

  • Experience working on SaaS web applications
  • Bonus: Docker or Kubernetes experience
  • Experience with US Healthcare / Managed Care Organizations, specifically around Compliance and RISK Assessments programs
  • BS in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)

What You'll Receive:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
  • 401k
  • PTO Plan
  • Fully stocked breakroom with drinks and snacks
  • Dog friendly office
  • Social gatherings
  • No commute to the Westside!

Reveleer is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis or race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.

results.title: Director of Product Management
results.description:
Socialive powers remote recording, video production and distribution, transforming enterprise-wide communications. It’s the fastest and most cost-effective way to deliver studio-quality video at scale. Socialive’s cloud video production platform removes the need and complexity of using multiple systems and tools, increasing the ability to easily produce more video featuring global, diverse talent. From beginners to full-fledged video experts, Socialive enables anyone in your organization to easily create on-brand, compliant video with less time and resources. Reduced costs and time savings unlock company-wide use cases that drive increased business value through better, more frequent video communications.

About our Team:
Our company culture is top priority and we strive to create an environment where all of our team members are empowered to do their best work. We’re proud of the collaborative culture we’ve built, even while working fully remote. We also understand that in order to be your best self you need time to relax and recharge. That’s why we encourage everyone at Socialive to take Mental Health Days each month, in addition to their PTO and our company-wide holiday shutdown. As a Built In 2022 Best Remote-First Place To Work winner, we’re growing our diverse, fully remote team with forward-thinking individuals who want to uplevel their careers while contributing to something bigger. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) is at the heart of Socialive’s success and we celebrate it in everything we do. Our mission is to be a leader in DEI and demonstrate what it truly means to be a place where all people can be bold and the best version of themselves. 100% Remote role. Socialive is seeking a Director of Product Management to help us expand Socialive’s competitive advantages in the market.



Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with the CTO and engineering leaders to define and communicate the long-term product vision, strategy, and roadmap.
  • Build and own the documentation for upcoming features and projects, detailing the user need, proposed solution, and high-level requirements, while building and refining wireframes to clearly communicate intent and foster collaboration and feedback with stakeholders.
  • Work with the go-to-market, marketing, and sales teams to understand and curate customer requests, and strategize with the engineering team on how to fulfill customer needs.
  • Ensure Socialive’s competitive advantage in the marketplace by identifying competitors, evaluating their strategies, and determining their strengths and weaknesses.
  • Using adaptive leadership skills to collaborate with the appropriate stakeholders per-project, driving forward the definition, scope, and requirements for implementation across multiple engineering teams while working across the company to support successful market delivery.


Experience you’ll ideally bring:
  • 7 or more years of Product experience in a SaaS environment
  • Experience working with enterprise customers as well as direct consumers
  • Experience with video and/or event production platforms is a plus but not required
  • Experience integrating with social media and video distribution platforms is a plus but not required
  • Proficient with product management (e.g. Productboard, Trello), wireframe/design (e.g. Balsamiq, Sketch, Figma), and Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence)
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience driving cross-functional efforts
This position is 100% remote, based in the US.

Compensation: commensurate with experience, $140,000-$170,000 plus equity

results.title: Sales Account Executive
results.description:
The Opportunity for you

Have fun in a rewarding role where you can make a great living selling a leading-edge SaaS technology, while truly helping customers grow their businesses.

Spoke Phone is a radically different cloud-based business phone system that unlocks the power of people and information, to drive 10x business growth for our customers.

Spoke Phone enables companies to:

  • Engage customers personally
  • Upskill employees to speak with knowledge and authority, and;
  • Automate repetitive tasks to fuel their business growth.

Spoke Phone customers typically see up to a 10x increase in the number of employees having great customer conversations and positive outcomes.

Our totally differentiated solution is easy to sell and commands a premium price in the market, enabling you to sell more and earn more.

Purpose of the role

The Account Executive (AE) role is a solution sales role. You will be responding to inbound leads, but mostly you will be partnering with marketing and your dedicated BDR, to develop your own outbound accounts and opportunities. You will be managing the entire sales lifecycle from performing discovery, identifying stakeholders, negotiating blockers, to recommending innovative solutions that provide value to our customers. You will bring in other teammates as needed during the sales cycle (solutions engineering, technology experts, legal, etc.), but you will control the process end-to-end.

What you'll need to bring to the role

You are a Solutions Sales Expert. You listen with the intent to understand. You will speak from a customer and use-case perspective and will work well with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You will be able to alter your conversation to highlight our value propositions in a way that is relatable to your audience, from the CEO, to business line managers, to the front-line workforce who will use Spoke everyday.  You will possess a level of technical understanding and/or experience in selling related technologies, (such as VoIP, Unified Communications, Contact Centers, or IT Networking, etc.), so you can talk with a level of technical authority, but no one expects you to know how it all works or implement it. 


Your are ready to take your next step in your career, prove yourself and then build a team around you. Here are the skills you will need:

  • Proven track record in selling $50,000+ ARR deals to enterprise customers.
  • 10+ years in sales, with at least 5 years in SaaS technology sales.
  • 3+ years selling into multiple-stakeholder opportunities with executive stakeholders and decision makers.
  • Proven success in demonstrating differentiated solution value and competitive advantages in a crowded market.
  • A background in related technologies, UC/CC/UCaaS/CCaaS/VoIP or networking solutions.
  • Understand business value selling methodologies and practices mapped to customer pains, with an ability to uncover customers' stated and unstated needs.
  • Excellent presentation and communications skills across various customer stakeholders; You are an experienced storyteller.
  • Ability to demonstrate our solution using a variety of online tools; You can think on your feet.
  • Customer-centric mindset with a demonstrated passion for delivering customer value.
  • Experienced problem solver able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written English.
What we'll do to ensure your success
  • A Business Development Rep (BDR) to help develop your opportunities and leads.
  • Marketing campaign development resources and ad-spend.
  • Access to Solutions Engineering, product leadership, and other resources to assist in opportunities.
  • Access to executive leadership to assist in key opportunities.
  • Continual coaching and mentoring.
  • Modern cloud sales operations, automation, and tools.
Location is remote/home
  • We will consider people based in the UK, Ireland, Prague or similar time-zones
  • Some travel may be required 
Salary, compensation, & lifestyle
  • Competitive base salary with no cap on how much you can earn (unlimited commission)
  • Excellent Healthcare plan
  • Work from home
  • Potential flexibility on working hours

results.title: Front-End Developer
results.description:
MGID was founded in 2008 and is one of the leading companies in native advertising. We enable our media partners to monetize their audience and help brands to promote their services and goods effectively.

MGID offers a range of integrated solutions covering the promotion process every step of the way; we offer services ranging from planning out the marketing strategy to its thoughtful implementation and optimization. Our clients include major international brands like Renault, Domino’s, Airbnb, PizzaHut, Qatar Airlines, and many others, including media organizations and web agencies.

MGID is:

— One of the largest MarTech-companies in the global market;

— A proprietary High-load service that delivers 185 billion advertisements to 850 million unique users in more than 70 languages;

— The winner of multiple AdTech awards for innovation and product quality;

— A workforce of 600+ employees operating from offices in the US, Europe, and Asia;

— A passion for cutting-edge technologies and a seamless vertical structure that allows the regional teams to exchange skills and development practices.

— 4+ years of experience in front-end development;

— 3+ years of experience with Angular;

— Knowledge:

JS (ES6+, TS);

HTML (HTML5);

CSS (CSS3, SCSS);

RxJS.

results.title: Sr. Product Manager
results.description:
Hive is an email marketing CRM used by brands to personalize and automate their marketing. We pride ourselves on helping brands keep their customers engaged, sell more, and continually improve their marketing.

We integrate with partners like Shopify and Ticketmaster to let brands act on their customer data in real-time, so they can easily segment customers and send perfectly targeted and customized emails & SMS.

We started our company in a University of Waterloo computer lab in early 2014, graduated from Y Combinator that summer (S14 batch) and have been growing ever since. You’ll join our team in Canada (hive.co/careers).

We’re looking for a passionate Product Manager to work alongside our engineering team to ensure we’re making good decisions and building as effectively as possible - while coordinating with other teams at Hive to communicate what/why we’re building (and not building) and the value it will bring to our customers.

You’ll be the first hire on the Product team and will get to dictate the tools we use, the systems we build and the processes that we follow.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own the roadmap - helping us drive as much impact as possible each development cycle, and find a home for valuable ideas that we’re not ready to build yet

  • Talk to customers, understand their problems, and translate these into opportunities for the business

  • Articulate your hypotheses clearly, validate them early and repeatedly, and know when to prototype, gather more data, or start fresh

  • Work with our developers to translate incoming items on the roadmap into clearly specced out tasks to be built

  • Help the team understand why we make the decisions we make, and how the product we ship will impact our customers

  • Work with marketing and CX to drive feature adoption

  • Work with sales and partnerships to ensure we’re leveraging product to drive new business

Who you are:

  • 5 + years of product experience at a software company - bonus points for SaaS or martech experience

  • Strong design skills and familiarity with at least 1 common design tool (we prefer Figma)

  • Familiarity with coding - you don’t need to be a CS major, but you should have a strong enough technical background to navigate your way through the more complex requirements of our product and infrastructure

  • Strong data analytics skills (SQL skills a bonus) and the ability to formulate analyses to answer key product questions

  • An insistence to work in a fast-paced, iterative environment

  • Excellent communication skills, paired with resourcefulness and the ability to act autonomously

  • Business sense - you can constantly spot and contrast various approaches to building the business, and enjoy assessing tradeoffs to make decisions

Bottom line... We're looking for curious, hardworking, down-to-earth people - who are passionate about product.

 

Comp/Benefits Package

  • Meaningful salary and equity: you're rewarded based on impact

  • Work fully remote in Canada: wherever you're happiest & productive

  • Flexible work hours: miminal meetings and no 9-5

  • Health & Dental coverage

  • Unlimited vacation/PTO: so you can be happy and healthy!

  • Comp Range $90-120k per year

     

To learn more about our team check out our About Us page on our website: https://www.hive.co/company

results.description:

results.title: Lead Designer
results.description:
You will be accountable for MUI's design execution and manage a small team of designers.

 

Details of the Role

  • Location: Remote (preference for UTC-6 to UTC+5).

  • Type of work: Full-time (contractor or employee depending on circumstances).

  • Level: 4 or above.

  • We're a remote company, we prefer asynchronous communication over meetings.

  • We work independently, the rest of us won't know what you're doing day-to-day unless you tell us.

 

About the company

MUI started with Material UI, the most successful React implementation of Google's Material Design. We have gained a large following, thanks to our focus on Material Design fidelity, our obsession with details, on offering a large number of components, our community engagement, and by carefully improving the DX. Today, countless teams and organizations rely on our open-source libraries to build their design system.

 

A couple of years ago, we started to expand our suite of products. We released MUI X, a collection of advanced components; MUI Design kits, the MUI components available for Figma, Sketch, etc.; and also host Templates, a set of pre-built UI kits. We've seen rapid growth with all of them (2-3x per year) and we have more to come. We are building a low-code platform for developers to significantly increase the speed and lower the barrier for creating simple CRUD/dashboard UIs with MUI.

 

We are a fully distributed team, spread across multiple time zones. We work mainly asynchronously, relying mostly on written collaboration. Every contributor has the freedom to define how they work — the rest of us won't know what you're doing day-to-day unless you tell us. For additional details about the MUI team and culture, you can check our careers and about pages and also our public Handbook.

 

Why we're hiring

Both our open-source community and our premium products are growing fast (x2 YoY). We need talented people to keep that going!

 

We are aiming to make high-end design accessible to the many, empowering developers that lack access to a designer as well as saving time for designers with a source they can trust. According to our last survey, the quality of the design execution (UX & UI) is the most important criteria used by developers & designers to pick their next UI library.

 

Why this is interesting

Our solution empowers React developers to build awesome applications faster – we see millions of developers on MUI's docs every year, one million a month.

But while we are the leading UI design system in the frontend space, the adoption of MUI is only at 25%. More importantly, the challenges of developers and designers to solve when creating UIs go way beyond the ones of design systems. We envision a future where MUI becomes the default toolkit for web developers to create UIs. It's why we started MUI Base, Joy UI, and MUI Toolpad. Design is key to achieving this goal.

 

About the role

 

What you'll do on a day-to-day basis

Depending on the day, you'll:

  • Ensure high-quality UI and UX across teams, libraries, components, and product strategy

  • Collaborate with product management and engineering to ensure that design work is aligned with business goals and user needs

  • Create design concepts, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups for projects on the X, Core, and Toolpad teams

  • Update and implement new components on the Core, X, and Toolpad teams

  • Develop and maintain MUI's design system and style guide

  • Oversee the design kits, ensuring they're aligned with engineering implementation

As a team leader, you will:

  • Manage the design process, including user research, user flows, and user testing

  • Review design work and provide feedback to ensure overall design quality and consistency, with consideration to both UI and UX.

  • Set goals, priorities, and distribute tasks for the design team

  • Provide mentorship and support to the design team members

  • Hire and retain a great team

 

About you

We're looking for someone with an expert eye for visual and UX design. You have enough development skills (C, JSX) to implement the designed interfaces. Details matter to you.

 

Skills you should have

  • Expert-level knowledge of graphic design. You can create great-looking UIs. You spot small kerning issues without even paying attention which makes you care about the details more than most people.

  • Expert-level knowledge of UX design. You can build intuitive UIs, both at the scope of an application and of a component micro-interaction.

  • Enough development skills to implement the designed interfaces. Our React engineers are often busy implementing complex components. We are looking for somebody with enough CSS and JavaScript skills to make small changes in autonomy and better understand the product.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills. As part of the team, you'll interface both directly and indirectly with community members and enterprise customers, and contribute to user documentation. Clear communication is fundamental in creating intuitive and compelling resources.

  • Management of a design team. Whether formally or informally, you have shown that you are a design leader and can provide guidance and support to other designers.

 

What would be nice if you had, but isn't required

  • You've contributed to a design system before. You have worked on a library of components in the past, maybe for internal usage in your company.

 

Benefits & Compensation

Competitive compensation depending on the profile and location. We are ready to pay top market rates for a person that can clearly exceed the role's expectations. You can find the other perks & benefits on the careers page.

results.title: Social Media Manager
results.description:
ABOUT HAPPITY:

Happity is a family friendly startup with a big mission! We're looking for a dynamic Social Media Manager to join our journey, helping new parents escape loneliness - especially on those long days spent as sole carer. We help parents connect in their communities by finding baby & toddler groups in their local area. This is a great time to join us as we expand across the UK!

We are a small team who are passionate about the work we do to end loneliness in new parents and we are proud of our achievements with our products. We have seen huge growth in the last year and currently have over 1m website users a year, approaching 100k parents subscribers to our mailing list, and over 26k active classes.

We work remotely and flexibly and this important new role will help us take Happity's marketing to the next level, bringing Happity to a wider national audience.  

If you have proven experience growing social media followings, are creative, innovative, detail driven and experienced in reporting then we want to hear from you! 

 

ABOUT YOU:

As you'll be working in a remote team, you'll need to be very self-motivated, able to manage your own time and an exceptional communicator! You'll also need to be available some weekends and evenings for engagement on posts.

You're someone who loves what Happity is about, you share our mission and want to make a positive difference in the world. You have a passion for helping us to grow as a brand.

You'll already have experience of growing a social media audience under your belt - whether that's been in a work capacity or other environment (such as voluntary or personal projects).

You don't need to be a parent to apply for this role, but you do need to demonstrate a sound knowledge of the market for baby & toddler classes - and in particular, what kind of content would appeal to an audience of new parents!

 

WHAT THE ROLE INVOLVES:

You will manage our social media presence, be responsible for generating content for social media, website, brand assets, advertising and more so that we can improve our brand awareness, customer responsiveness and ultimately make an even greater impact with our product.

The main responsibilities of this role include: 

  • Creating a social media content strategy to fit within our marketing strategy
  • Creating, scheduling and engaging on posts and stories (currently on Instagram and Facebook)
  • Managing our Facebook Group to build community
  • Reporting on progress and improving strategy
  • Supporting or managing campaigns

It may also include:

  • Blog, Website and Advertising creation
  • Assisting with PR and other marketing tasks including engaging with influencers

 

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

What we're hoping to see highlighted on your CV and application:

Essential:

  • Social Media Strategy & Management - to be able to deliver on Happity's commercial and impact-driven goals. You'll be responsible for managing our online community of providers and parents, analysing and reporting social media activity (this should be using software such as Later or Buffer.) Reporting is across all channels - on acquisition, engagement, top-performing content etc. You would attend and contribute to monthly marketing meetings to shape the marketing strategy for the brand, discuss and review upcoming content, and review marketing campaigns.
  • Design - you will also have some experience with design software such as Canva, have an eye for design and fantastic attention to detail, being comfortable to edit, repurpose and create imagery, graphics and video / animations for use across our channels
  • Startup mentality: While we're an established, scaling organisation, we work very much like a lean, agile startup. You need to be great at prioritising (and knowing which corners to cut) - and working closely with a tight-knit, small team.
  • Passion for social media: You need to have in-depth knowledge of social media channels and a proven track record of creating and sustaining online communities. 
  • Creativity: We are looking for a person with loads of creativity and new ideas to improve our content, whether written, image or video. You will have fantastic copy-writing skills across both short-form (social media posts, ad copy etc) and long-form content (blogs, articles, press releases) and lots of good ideas! We are looking for someone with excellent written and verbal English language skills for the position. 
  • Analytical, customer-driven mindset: You're able to use your analytical brain to spot trends and identify opportunities for future activity. Alongside this you will be involved in analysing the SEO performance of our website content, identifying relevant keywords and ensuring our content targets those effectively.
  • Ability to learn new tools: You must be able to learn how to use new marketing tools with ease. Experience with HTML and website Content Management Systems as well as experience using email service providers (we use Active Campaign and Mailerlite currently) and CRM systems is a strong plus, but not a requirement for the job.
  • Purpose driven: We're making real social impact. We truly believe in what we're doing and want you to be part of that. 

Desirable:

  • You have experience managing paid advertising (Facebook, Google etc.)
  • You have good knowledge of site analytics tools (Google Analytics)
  • You have experience in PR and Partnerships
  • You have experience growing early-stage companies to post Series A in the consumer space
  • You have experience in a parenting company or digital solutions

 

All applicants should mention the word "Firework" to show they've read the requirements ;-)

 

Benefits and reasons why the role might appeal:

  • Work closely with the Founders of a purpose-led, exciting and fast-growing parentings brand
  • Join a friendly and fun marketing team made up of a mix of freelancers and part-time employees
  • Opportunity to provide key strategic input to key marketing and business strategies
  • Opportunity to work remotely and flexible, with unlimited holiday
  • Growth opportunity: as Happity grows there will be opportunity for the role to further expand 

 

HOW TO APPLY

If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career in a socially-motivated, and growing business then please apply today by submitting your CV along with a cover letter outlining:

  • Why Happity?
  • Why this role?
  • Why you?
  • Example of relevant previous work

 

HOURS & COMPENSATION

Hours: 15-18 hours per week initially with potential to grow if suitable

Pay: £15-18 per hour depending on experience

Closing Date: 31st Jan 2023 with rolling interviews so the position may be filled sooner.

Happity is an equal opportunity employer and all applicants will be considered for employment regardless of ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or disability status.

results.title: Senior Full-stack Developer
results.description:
Who we are

We're the tech team at Buyapowa, a marketing tech firm from London. We are now a fully distributed team working remotely across Europe and also Vancouver. We're 100% remote with asynchronous work at our process and policy at our core.

We value:

  • People that test first
  • Continuous improvement
  • Owning and supporting the things we build
  • Choosing appropriate technology to solve problems
  • Solving customer problems first
  • Sustainable pace

We're hitting the next phase in our growth and so we're hiring in a number of roles.  We need you to help take our product, and scale, to the next level.

The Role

As a senior full-stack developer, you will join the team responsible for product development of our platform services. These are high scale SPAs backed by one or more backend services. This includes the referral marketing technology embedded in client sites, as well as the CRM and CMS systems that support it.

We lean toward choosing the right tool for the job, meaning you get to work with tools and methods you decide are right. We have a good mix of supporting existing apps, building new customer experiences, and constantly delivering new features for our in-house team all with high quality feedback cycles.

Our tech stack is primarily React front ends backed by Ruby / Rails, Postgres, and Redis. Standard stuff. We leverage Heroku and lower-level AWS services through Terraform to bring our platform to enterprise-level clients with high security and scale requirements.

We also have a small number of services built in Elixir and AWS Lambda services running Go.

You will be expected to:

  • Design solutions from the ground up
  • TDD all of your code
  • Review code from other members of your team
  • Pair with other members of your team
  • Troubleshoot
  • Take full responsibility for stories from inception to delivery
  • Work closely with Product managers and company wide stakeholders
  • Help your teammates improve in their skills and knowledge
  • Be part of a diverse team to see how diversity leads to high performing teams

You have

  • TDD as a standard for all of your work
  • > 5 years Javascript (ES6 and Typescript) experience
  • Proven modern React (16.8 >) experience
  • Some experience with an OOP language for back end API's (Ruby / C# / Python)
  • Proficiency with Git source control
  • Strong HTML and CSS ability
  • Good communication skills in written, verbal, and code

We'll give you the opportunity to

  • Use a variety of technologies
  • Bring new suggestions to the table for evaluation and experimentation
  • Deliver business value to end users with cycle times measured in days and weeks, not months and quarters
  • Work at a sustainable pace so you can enjoy your productivity

We'll help you

  • Ensure your work is challenging
  • Grow you to the next stage of your career
  • Impact the business in a meaningful way
  • Develop skills outside of pure tech
  • Fund your learning with time and money
  • Give you the space to concentrate AND make sure you don't feel isolated

Benefits working at Buyapowa

Learning & development. We'll give you the opportunity to learn, including a personal learning budget for your professional growth.

Ownership. We've got big plans and we want you to share in the upside. That's why you'll get to participate in a generous equity incentive plan.

Wellbeing. We're looking forward to seeing you grow in your professional life, but we also care about your wellbeing. That's why you'll receive an annual wellness budget, to spend just on you - no questions asked.

Work / life balance. Taking a break is super important to all of us. In fact, it's something that's gently encouraged, coaxed and nudged on a regular basis.

WFH Support. Our ethos is to prioritise the distributed team. While we have hubs and we love getting together, our priority is to invest in getting you set up to work remotely so you can collaborate with ease. So, whatever you need to be amazing, it's on us..

Family life. Being part of the Buyapowa family is important to us, but we know you have a life outside of our team, too. Whatever family / home life looks like to you, we offer flexible working.

We launched in October 2019 and in the short time since then have built a large law firm customer base who love our product and our team.

We have an agile, ambitious and collaborative team. With deep experience across design, tech and the industry, we put our employees first. We’re looking for people who can grow with us.

Our core values are agility, ambition, and collaboration. We rely heavily on data and first principles decision-making.

The Role

As our Senior Software Engineer, you’ll be immersed across every part of our technical process. Working closely and collaboratively with our agile squads, you’ll design and build elegant solutions to complex user problems. As part of our journey to transform the Legal industry, our Engineering team is key to delivering our best-in-class user experience.

Joining a cross-functional team built on collaboration, you will have the opportunity to build across the full stack from back end, front end, platform and more. Helping to set the technical direction and mentoring of Junior Engineers,

Our progression pathways are flexible around where you see your future heading - if you're interested in potentially managing other engineers, we can support this as much as supporting diving into our most complex technical challenges.

You’ll also be helping us to continuously improve how we work - whether that’s with new ways of working, new best practice or new tools & technologies.

Joining as a technical leader, you’ll take ownership of complex back end challenges. There’s no expectation that you are as comfortable across the whole stack, but continuous learning and continuous improvement is integral to our agile ways of working.

Our Stack and Environment

We work in collaborative, cross-functional, agile development teams that are empowered to achieve their goals, with a focus on working smart to delivering value early and quickly. We have an agile system that aims to provide structure where we need it and get out of the way the rest of the time, and we’re always looking for ways to improve our processes. The same is true for our development tools and practices, where we aim to automate what we can, collaborate where we can and are constantly on the lookout for new ideas that will enable us to work better.

We primarily use Python and Django on the back end and modern Javascript using Google’s Lit web component framework on the front end (this will be soon migrated to Vue.js). We host and deploy using Heroku, with CircleCI used for continuous integration. Testing is embedded into the core of an Engineer’s role at Legl.

Requirements

Significant experience in a modern software engineering environment, whether that is in a full stack or back end capacity

  • Built web applications in an agile environment as part of a cross-functional team
  • Willing to work across the front and back end, even if you’re more experienced on one side
  • Passionate about technology, and excited to learn through experience and collaboration
  • Product-minded, always aim to understand the core of the problem and focus on the objective you’re aiming to achieve
  • Committed to continuous improvement, and have mentored, trained or led engineers to success
  • Write clean, performant, tested and maintainable code
  • Care about impact, love a challenge, and take ownership of your work
  • If you’re not sure if you meet all of these requirements, but it sounds like the right role for you, then we’d still encourage you to apply!

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and share options: we all share in Legl’s success
  • Legl has a dynamic, remote-first culture, with a focus on making work work for you. We give generous budgets for home set-ups, co-working space use if you need or want it and access to office spaces for collaboration in person, no matter where you live.
  • Twice-annual offsites to get to socialise with your colleagues in person.
  • Opportunity to join a well-funded, post-Series B startup in our mission to make legal services better for everyone
  • High impact work that really matters - success in this role will drive our growth and have a big impact on the business and our clients
  • A focus on wellbeing with access to support sessions with a psychotherapist and a personal wellbeing budget of £250 per year
  • A learning and development budget of £1000 per year
  • Regular company off-sites, where we all get together in-person, as well as frequent remote social events

Diversity

We believe that having diverse teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

results.title: Recruitment coordinator
results.description:
Since 2015 Sweatcoin and now Sweat Economy is working on making the world more physically active. With more than 100 million registered users, thousands of partners and a proven ability to make people move more (+20%) Sweat Economy has already become the largest onramp in web3 history. We now working on turning our token - $SWEAT - into the principal unit of physical activity value and building an economy of movement around it.

As a Recruitment Coordinator your mission will be to create the best candidate experience in Europe, you will be a crucial part in managing all of our recruitment process smoothly and a key contributor to our Talent Teams success.

Apply, if you have:

  • Commercial work experience in HR for more than 6 months at a startup or scale up (preferably in a Recruitment Role)

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with the confidence to work independently, prioritize responsibilities, and manage time efficiently

  • Passion for keeping processes organized.

  • Openness to learn, develop and constantly improve

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Ensuring smooth communication between all the recruitment stakeholders: introductions, scheduling, feedback sharing, etc.

  • Being the main first point of contact for candidates: CV screening, initial communication (e-mailing, messaging), initial interviews, replying to ad-hoc questions, scheduling meetings, follow up, etc.

  • Keeping an eye on the necessary data being up to date: ATS, job specs, feedback, etc.

  • Come up with new ideas on how we can optimize and improve candidate experience and recruitment process

  • Ad hoc operational tasks that extend beyond the standard process

 

What you will get in return:

    • Remote-friendly & Flexible working hours. The flexibility is incredible, performance is based on output, rather than hours spent working, our core hours are (10:00-16:00 GMT)
    • Stock options after 12 months of employment (50% of Basic Salary)
    • Winter office in Lisbon. We spend up to 2 months in the sunniest city of Europe during winter with the coverage of accommodation, flights, visas and insurance for you and your partner/family.
    • Team building abroad in exciting locations!
    • 20 days holiday (excluding public holiday) + Week off at Christmas
    • 1 extra day off, for each year of service (up to 5)
    • Two office locations, London and Lisbon, in case you'd like to work from the office sometime
    • Wellbeing program, (up to 2 counselling session per month)
    • Health Insurance, for our employees joining outside UK or PT you have a 1000€ yearly allowance.

 

Application process: 
Initial submission -> CV Screening ->1st Talent Screening -> 2nd Talent Screening -> Final interview -> 2/3 References

results.title: Head of Compliance and Permanent Control
results.description:
As a Head of Compliance and Permanent Control, you’ll need to ensure all of Deblock’s products meet regulatory requirements. To do this, you’ll have a chance to build the Financial Crime and Anti-Money Laundering Control Framework from scratch.

You’ll be part of the leadership team for our regulated entity and will design, lead and shape the future of oversight and compliance.

Your speed, ability to deliver, and capacity to come up with the most elegant solutions that are compliant and offer the best customer experience will make you one of the pillars of our team.

We want to revolutionize the FinTech industry. Create a new paradigm. And we need the best minds to do it 🧠 🚀

 

👀 What we are looking for
  • Professional qualification from an internationally recognized body (e.g. ICA, ACAMS)
  • Deep knowledge of the EU regulatory environment and key financial crime regimes
  • Ability to exercise oversight, knowledge, and understanding of financial crime and AML policies, procedures, and control arrangements in a complex financial operation
🤩 What will make you stand out
  • Experience building FinCrime products
  • Experience working in a crypto company
🧑‍💻 What you’ll be working on
  • Defining, developing, managing, refining, and documenting the Financial Crime and AML Program to manage all sources of regulatory risk and provide reporting which meets the needs of the regulator, local and Group management
  • Determining identification and verification standards for customer take-on and AML compliance
  • Managing the suspicious activity reporting process, internally and externally
  • Receiving and promptly responding to inquiries from law enforcement agencies
  • Supporting the business where necessary regarding the launch of products to ensure regulatory requirements are met, as appropriate
  • Communicating with all necessary staff to ensure they understand their responsibilities and are trained in Deblock policies and procedures to identify financial crime, and escalate suspicious activity by making internal reports and make external reports to the regulators and other law enforcement bodies in a timely manner
🤑 What you’ll get
  • Competitive salary and a stock options sign-on bonus
  • The best tech for your job
  • 30 days of paid holidays (excl. bank holidays)
  • Option to work 100% remotely or come to the office - your choice!
  • Ability to work abroad for 4 months a year
